intro: Chrysanthemum lineare, commonly known as the linear chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. This species belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Chrysanthemum lineare typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and traditional herbal use.
